page.title: 05A SHILLINGSTONE VIEWPOINT
page.content: It was by pure chance that we set up home in Shillingstone in 1975-a happy chance as we soon discovered from the friendliness and strong community spirit here,centered largely on the Parish Church and Primary School. Certainly a great deal of the friendliness stems from a strong communal desire to support and maintain the village school.That is what makes Shillingstone such a wortwhile and rewarding place in which to live.We have found that "native" villagers accept newcomers like ourselves without too much suspicion.Perhaps this is because there are fewer class barriers than in some communities and more cooperation and support for village organisations by all sections of the community than is usual. Chris Whitfeld.
